title: The Golden Circle: Start With Why
narration: Welcome to an exploration of Simon Sinek's powerful Golden Circle model. This model provides a framework for understanding what truly inspires and motivates people and how businesses can leverage this understanding to build lasting success. Join us as we delve into the core principles of the Golden Circle and discover how starting with Why can transform your approach to leadership and value proposition.

title: Introducing the Golden Circle
content:
A simple but powerful model for inspirational leadership.
Based on how the human brain makes decisions.
Provides a framework for understanding value proposition.
image_desc: Golden circle diagram with Why, How, What in concentric circles. Type: diagram
narration: The Golden Circle is a model that illustrates how inspirational leaders and organizations think act and communicate. It's based on the biology of human decisionmaking specifically how the brain responds to different types of messaging. The model emphasizes the importance of understanding your Why before defining your How and What.

title: The Three Levels of the Golden Circle
content: Caption: The Golden Circle illustrates the importance of starting with "Why".
image_desc: Golden circle diagram with Why, How, What in concentric circles, each with a short description. Type: diagram
narration: The Golden Circle consists of three interconnected levels Why How and What. Each level represents a different aspect of an organization's purpose and operations. Understanding the relationships between these levels is crucial for creating a compelling and authentic message.

title: What: The Outer Circle
content:
Every organization knows WHAT they do.
These are the products they sell or the services they offer.
This is the easiest level to identify.
image_desc: Text "What" in a circle, surrounded by examples like "We sell computers", "We offer legal services". Type: graphic
narration: What refers to the tangible products or services that a company offers. It's the most obvious and easily identifiable aspect of any organization. Most companies communicate primarily at this level focusing on the features and benefits of their offerings.

title: How: The Middle Circle
content:
Some organizations know HOW they do it.
These are the things that make them special or set them apart from the competition.
Often explained as a company's unique selling proposition (USP).
image_desc: Text "How" in a circle, surrounded by examples like "Proprietary technology", "Exceptional customer service". Type: graphic
narration: How represents the specific actions or processes that differentiate a company from its competitors. This includes unique selling propositions core values and distinctive capabilities. While many organizations understand their What fewer are clear on their How.

title: Why: The Inner Circle
content:
Very few organizations know WHY they do what they do.
This is not about making a profit. That's a result.
WHY is a purpose, cause, or belief. It's the very reason your organization exists.
image_desc: Text "Why" in a circle, surrounded by examples like "To inspire creativity", "To challenge the status quo". Type: graphic
narration: Why is the core purpose cause or belief that drives an organization. It's the reason the company exists beyond simply making a profit. Understanding and communicating your Why is essential for inspiring loyalty and attracting likeminded individuals.

title: The Power of Starting With Why
content:
**Traditional Approach (Outside-In)**
What: We make great computers.
How: They are beautifully designed, simple to use, and user-friendly.
Why: (Implied, often profit-driven)
**Golden Circle Approach (Inside-Out)**
Why: Everything we do, we believe in challenging the status quo. We believe in thinking differently.
How: The way we challenge the status quo is by making our products beautifully designed, simple to use, and user-friendly.
What: We happen to make great computers.
image_desc: Comparison table of outside-in vs inside-out approach. Type: diagram
narration: The traditional approach starts with What and moves outward often failing to connect with customers on an emotional level. The Golden Circle approach starting with Why creates a sense of purpose and inspires action. By communicating your Why first you attract people who believe in what you believe.

title: The Biological Basis
content:
The "Why" corresponds to the limbic brain.
The limbic brain controls feelings, trust, and decision-making.
The "What" corresponds to the neocortex.
The neocortex controls rational and analytical thought.
image_desc: Diagram of the human brain highlighting the limbic system and neocortex. Type: diagram
narration: Sinek argues that the Golden Circle aligns with the structure of the human brain. The Why resonates with the limbic brain which governs emotions trust and decisionmaking. The What corresponds to the neocortex responsible for rational thought and analysis.

title: Inspiring Action
content:
People don't buy WHAT you do; they buy WHY you do it.
The goal is not to sell to everyone who needs what you have.
The goal is to sell to people who believe what you believe.
image_desc: Image of a crowd of people following a leader. Type: photograph
narration: People are more likely to be inspired and motivated by a company's Why than by its What. When you communicate your purpose you attract customers and employees who share your values and beliefs. This creates a stronger sense of loyalty and advocacy.

title: Building Trust and Loyalty
content:
Starting with "Why" builds trust.
Trust leads to loyalty.
Loyal customers become advocates.
image_desc: Graphic depicting a chain reaction: Why -> Trust -> Loyalty -> Advocacy. Type: diagram
narration: Communicating your Why fosters trust with your audience. When people understand and believe in your purpose they are more likely to trust your brand. This trust translates into loyalty and loyal customers become advocates spreading the word about your company.

title: Applying the Golden Circle
content:
**For Businesses**
Define your "Why": What's your purpose?
Communicate your "Why" consistently.
Attract customers who share your values.
**For Individuals**
Discover your personal "Why": What drives you?
Align your actions with your "Why".
Find fulfillment in your work and life.
image_desc: Two columns, one for business applications and one for individual applications. Type: graphic
narration: The Golden Circle can be applied to both businesses and individuals. For businesses it's about defining and communicating your purpose to attract likeminded customers. For individuals it's about discovering your personal Why and aligning your actions with your core values to find fulfillment.

title: Conclusion: The Power of Purpose
content: Caption: Start with Why to inspire and lead.
image_desc: Image of a compass pointing towards the word "Purpose". Type: graphic
narration: In conclusion Simon Sinek's Golden Circle model emphasizes the importance of starting with Why. By understanding and communicating your purpose you can inspire action build trust and create lasting value. Embrace the power of Why to transform your leadership and value proposition.
